title: Greeting People by Name
goal: Greet and say goodbye to people using `coi` and `co'o` with names.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Practice your introduction from yesterday:

mi'e .yourname.

Say it 3 times. Now Lojbanize these names quickly:

  1. Anna → ?
  2. Sam → ?
  3. Kate → ?

(Answers: .anas., .sam., .keit.)

New Material (5-7 min)

Hello and Goodbye

coi la .alis. — Hello, Alice.

Lojban has special words called vocatives for social interactions. Today you'll learn the two most important:

Vocative Meaning Usage
coi hello greeting someone
co'o goodbye parting from someone

Using la for Names

When you use a name in a sentence (not just as an introduction), you need la before it:

Lojban English
coi la .alis. Hello, Alice.
co'o la .bob. Goodbye, Bob.
coi la .paris. Hello, Paris. (greeting a city!)

The pattern: vocative + la + name

la vs. No la

Compare:

Lojban Meaning Notes
mi'e .alis. I'm Alice. No la — mi'e directly takes the name
coi la .alis. Hello, Alice. la required — marks the name as a sumti

Think of la as "the one called" — it turns a cmevla into a sumti you can use anywhere.

Responding to Greetings

When someone says coi to you, respond with coi:

A: coi la .bob.     (Hello, Bob.)
B: coi la .alis.    (Hello, Alice.)

When someone says co'o, respond with co'o:

A: co'o la .bob.    (Goodbye, Bob.)
B: co'o la .alis.   (Goodbye, Alice.)

Examples

Lojban Gloss English
coi la .tam. hello [name Tom] Hello, Tom.
co'o la .meris. goodbye [name Mary] Goodbye, Mary.
coi la .tokios. hello [name Tokyo] Hello, Tokyo.
co'o la .lyndyn. goodbye [name London] Goodbye, London.

Key Point

Use coi for hello and co'o for goodbye. Add la before names: coi la .name.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Greet These People

Write the greeting in Lojban:

  1. Say hello to Alice.
  2. Say goodbye to Bob.
  3. Say hello to Tom.
  4. Say goodbye to Sarah.
  5. Say hello to yourself (your Lojbanized name).
Answers
  1. coi la .alis.
  2. co'o la .bob.
  3. coi la .tam.
  4. co'o la .seras.
  5. coi la .yourname.

Exercise 2: Complete the Dialogue

Fill in the blanks:

A: coi la .bob.
B: ___ la .alis.        (hello back)

A: co'o la .bob.
B: ___ la .alis.        (goodbye back)
Answers 
A: coi la .bob.
B: coi la .alis.

A: co'o la .bob.
B: co'o la .alis.

Exercise 3: Lojbanize and Greet

Think of 3 people you know. Lojbanize their names, then write a greeting for each:

  1. Name: _______ → Lojban: ._______. → Greeting: coi la ._______.
  2. Name: _______ → Lojban: ._______. → Greeting: coi la ._______.
  3. Name: _______ → Lojban: ._______. → Greeting: coi la ._______.

Say each greeting aloud.

items.text: Say hello to yourself (your Lojbanized name).

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. Greet Alice: coi la .alis.
  2. Introduce yourself: mi'e .yourname.
  3. Say goodbye to Alice: co'o la .alis.

Now put it together as a mini-conversation:

coi la .alis. .i mi'e .yourname. .i co'o la .alis.

Say the whole thing aloud twice.

Today's Vocab

Cmavo introduced today:

Lojban Function
coi hello (vocative)
co'o goodbye (vocative)
la article marking a name (turns cmevla into sumti)

Summary

You learned coi (hello) and co'o (goodbye), and how to use la before names when greeting people. You can now greet anyone by name: coi la .name.

Tomorrow preview: You'll learn words for people — prenu (person), nanmu (man), ninmu (woman), and verba (child).
